channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Traffic Chaos, 20th May
item.description:
There are road works on the A435, north and south of the Hyde Lane junction. There are roadworks on the Stoke Orchard road, New Road from Woodmancote to Southam is closed. Kayte Lane, Two Hedges Road and others are grid lock. Where is the Highways planning & coorcindation ? GCC need to get a grip of this appalling situation before drivers frustration leads to a serious accident. I shall watch this report with interest to see if anything is done.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kayte Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain rusted and thin in places, 20th May
item.description:
The drain cover is looking very think in places and could give way soon.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shutter Lane, Gotherington, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bikes abandoned, 20th May
item.description:
2 mountain bikes have been abandoned and completely stripped of most parts. They are causing an obstruction to the public highway along the High Street outside Go Outdoors. These bikes have been like this since the start of the year. Why no worker from Ubico have noticed these and reported them for removal is beyond me. There needs to be zero tolerance to such items in order for the streets to look at their best...that goes for all the left behind bike locks that number in the dozens left locked around many of the town centre bike racks. Oh, and whatever those rather large cumbersome and ugly half domes are popping up everywhere what a eyesore.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albert Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Heavy vegetation growth, 20th May
item.description:
The two cycle lanes are heavy in vegetation growth blocking safe passageway of cyclists. Maybe instead of wasting 45 million on a new cycle route maintain the ones we already have. This issue has been prevalent for at least the last 6 months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albert Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Elmbridge, Gloucester

item.title: Numerous potholes all along this road, 19th May
item.description:
Numerous potholes all along this road from the junction all the way along past the school. The road is a disgrace and has been for some time. Please repair all of the potholes/craters!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fairfield Parade, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Developers Signage, 19th May
item.description:
A developer has placed a sign on the official finger post. This seriously hinders the view north along the A435 from the junction with Malleson Road. This location is a known accident black spot and anything that hinders visibility is of concern. Please can you arrange for it to be removed before it contibutes to a serious accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Malleson Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 19th May
item.description:
Drain has been smelling bad for a while and looks like a oily film on the water and the sump is still partially full. Please can this be investigated as it is very unpleasant.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yellow lines too close to island on road. Parking issues., 19th May
item.description:
Barley Road, island at the top of the road. The yellow lines are not going far enough along the road to make sure there is enough space to safely pass through. Emergency vehicles would not be able to pass through without having to significantly slow down with risk to damage to their cars and the parked ones.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Barley Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Drain blocked with dirt/dust, 19th May
item.description:
The drain is on a lane I think called Langdon Terrace between Ewlyn Road and Langdon Road. I am not sure if the lane is a public highway or not but the drain runs into the drains on Langdon Road and so the dirt/dust will run down to public highway if not cleaned out quickly before we get heavy rain. As you can see from picture it is very full and so would not want this to wash down into drainage system.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Langdon Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
